title: What is React?
answer_1: A programming language
answer_2: A server-side framework
right_answer: A front-end JavaScript library

title: What is JSX in React?
answer_1: A JavaScript syntax extension
answer_2: A server-side rendering technique
right_answer: A JavaScript syntax extension

title: What is the purpose of React components?
answer_1: To style web pages
answer_2: To define the structure of an HTML document
right_answer: To create reusable UI elements

title: In React, what is the significance of the 'state'?
answer_1: It stores the data that can be changed over time
answer_2: It defines the initial properties of a component
answer_3: It specifies the layout of the component
right_answer: It stores the data that can be changed over time

title: What is the purpose of the 'props' in React?
answer_1: To define the layout of a component
answer_2: To handle events in a component
right_answer: To pass data between components

title: What is the virtual DOM in React?
answer_1: An imaginary representation of the browser's Document Object Model
answer_2: A testing library for React components
right_answer: An imaginary representation of the browser's Document Object Model

title: What is a React component lifecycle method?
answer_1: A method to create a new component
answer_2: A method to update the component state
answer_3: A method to manage the lifecycle of a component
right_answer: A method to manage the lifecycle of a component

title: What is the purpose of the 'render()' method in a React component?
answer_1: To define the component's initial state
answer_2: To handle events in the component
right_answer: To render the component's UI

title: What is React Router used for?
answer_1: To manage component state
answer_2: To handle HTTP requests
answer_3: To create routes and navigation in a React app
right_answer: To create routes and navigation in a React app

title: What is the purpose of the 'setState()' method in React?
answer_1: To define the initial state of a component
answer_2: To update the component's state and trigger a re-render
answer_4: To define the layout of a component
right_answer: To update the component's state and trigger a re-render

title: What are React Hooks?
answer_1: Functional components in React
answer_2: A way to write class components
answer_3: Functions that let you use state and other React features in functional components
answer_4: A form of CSS styling in React
right_answer: Functions that let you use state and other React features in functional components

title: What is the purpose of the 'useEffect()' hook in React?
answer_1: To handle user interactions
answer_2: To perform side effects in functional components
right_answer: To perform side effects in functional components

title: What is the role of 'Redux' in a React application?
answer_1: To manage component state
answer_2: To create animations in React
answer_3: To manage the global state of an application
right_answer: To manage the global state of an application

title: What is the purpose of the 'key' prop in React lists?
answer_1: To define the order of list items
answer_2: To provide a unique identifier for each list item
answer_3: To apply styles to list items
right_answer: To provide a unique identifier for each list item

title: What is the significance of the 'Context API' in React?
answer_1: To handle forms in React
answer_2: To create global state accessible to all components
answer_4: To define the layout of a component
right_answer: To create global state accessible to all components

title: What is the purpose of the 'Fragment' in React?
answer_1: To create a new React component
answer_2: To group multiple elements without adding an extra node to the DOM
right_answer: To group multiple elements without adding an extra node to the DOM

title: What is the purpose of the 'componentDidMount()' lifecycle method in a React class component?
answer_1: To update the component state
answer_2: To handle events
answer_3: To perform actions after the component has been initially rendered
answer_4: To define the layout of the component
right_answer: To perform actions after the component has been initially rendered

title: What is the role of 'React Router DOM' in a React application?
answer_1: To handle HTTP requests
answer_2: To create global state accessible to all components
answer_3: To manage navigation and routing in a React app
answer_4: To define the initial state of a component
right_answer: To manage navigation and routing in a React app

title: What is the purpose of the 'propTypes' feature in React?
answer_1: To set the default props for a component
answer_2: To define the data types of a component's props
right_answer: To define the data types of a component's props

title: What is a 'React Hook'?
answer_1: A function that allows you to use state and other React features in functional components
answer_2: A type of class component in React
answer_3: A way to handle form submissions in React
answer_4: A method to define the initial state of a component
right_answer: A function that allows you to use state and other React features in functional components
